subject: Using a 2nd set of VAMs in addtion to the pedal set.
description_text:
Hi SIMSONN,

I got a new set of Simsonn Pro X Ultra Sim Racing Pedals with VAM Haptic
Reactors which work great.

So now I'm wondering if I can order another set of 3 VAM Haptic Reactors so
I have two sets of VAM reactors on my rig for more effects.

I have the *Pro X Ultra Pedal Control Box* for reactors on my pedals, I'm
wondering if I could use a *second Plus X Pedal Control Box *to control
another set of 3 reactors attached to my seat without the 2 boxes
conflicting with each other.

I plan to use SimHub to control the effects so I don't need your software
to detect both but I'm wondering if I have both will they confuse your
software?

Thank you for your time,
Lloyd Johnston

conversations.body_text: Hi Lloyd Johnston,  We will conduct a test on Monday to see if it can be compatible with both control units, and then get back to you.

Hi Lloyd Johnston,   This is not easy to achieve, but you could consider purchasing a control box from another brand. We hadn’t taken into account the scenario where two SIMSONN control boxes are used simultaneously with SimHub and SIMSONN Manager, which can cause conflicts.

Ok, thank you for getting back to me.

Im thinking of getting a simmagic box to drive your vams

Thanks for checking
Lloyd
Hi Lloyd Johnston,  However, please note that driving a VAM with Simagic can easily cause damage, as Simagic only supports the voice-coil motor mode.
